page.title: 01HOLLINGBOURNE TO HARRIETSHAM
page.content: The area covered by this D-block is dominated by the North Downs which traverse it from the north-west corner to the south-east corner.The North Downs have their steep slope on the southern side and at the foot of this slope lies the old medieval centre of Hollingbourne Village,mentioned in the original Domesday Survey,with its church and impressive manor house. In the south-east corner of the block lie the outskirts of the village of Harrietsham,its parish church,St. John the Baptist,and the imposing Stede Hill House which has occupied its elevated position on the chalk hills for at least the last three and a half centuries.Between the two run the ancient trackways of the Pilgrim's Way and the North Downs Way and on either side hamlets dotted around beautiful farmhouses.
